fields.description: This issue has come up twice recently, users often have old build result XML files and logs lying around in file system.
fields.summary: Create a re-synching tool to delete orphaned build logs and xml files on disk.
Locked externals in SVN causes infinite building loop

fields.description:
The (re)vision numbers aren't matching with perforce.

For example, the diff link looks like:

http://hostname/path?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&r1=3&r2=4

where it should look like

http://hostname/path?content-type=text/vnd.viewcvs-markup&r1=133611&r2=133753

A similar problem happens with the "(version n)" link; it's got the wrong revision number in the text and the href, ie 4 instead of 133753.

Hopefully an easy one for you guys to fix. 

Cheers,

David
fields.summary: File Version Number problems with Perforce

fields.description: Cannot add new plans with Subversion repositories as authentication always fails.
fields.summary: Authentication always fails for subversion repository

fields.description: The RSS feed from Bamboo seems to report from the oldest result to the newest (newest on the bottom of the report). When using RSS readers (such as Confluence), they tend to read straight down, placing the older information on the top. It would be more useful if the newest build was set at the top, so that it is the first item found on the RSS feed.
fields.summary: RSS Feed information should have up to date information on the top of the xml form

fields.description:
When a build is enabled or disabled, it should send an IM notification to those receiving IM notifications for that build.

The IM should be sent if someone manually disables/enables the build, or if bamboo disables a plan automatically.
fields.summary: When a build is enabled or disabled, it should send an IM notification to those receiving im notifications for that build

fields.description: Same issue as BAM-529 except it occurs when clicking the Completed Builds tab
fields.summary: "operation not permitted" clicking Completed Builds tab

fields.description:
As we host several plans on bamboo and give access to external users we urgently need a feature allowing us to block/grant access to plans. It'd be perfect if you can enable a forced whitelisting. I think this feature will be in great demand for software companies outsourcing some of their works.

As you are currently develop the ldap features this should of course integrate in using ldap groups as security flag for access to special plans.
fields.summary: access control to specific plan (based on groups)

fields.description:
One strategy could be to always pull one revision at a time.

Another strategy could be to pull one revision at a time but only up to some threshold (i.e. - if you are within 3 revisions of current). Beyond that threshold, maybe a 'catch-up' (pull current) makes sense.

Another strategy could be to pull up to x changesets/revisions at a time (to put a hard limit on the number of changesets integrated in each build).

What is considered excessive might be flexible depending on server resources available to you and the time it takes your projects to build.

N.B. This issue was first discussed in the forums http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257246130
fields.summary: Bamboo should bulid each revision till the latest revision when performing builds, so that user can figure out which commit broke the build

fields.description:
New installation of Bamboo on a fresh server
No code has been check out of this repository
SVN server has a self signed SSL certificate

Create a new project
Choose SVN
Enter https repository URL https://<server_with_self_signed_cert>/path/to/repos
Enter username and password

Receive misleading error "Authentication required for '<https://servername:443> CCAD'" 

The real problem is that svn is prompting the user about the self-signed certificate.

The WORKAROUND is to check the code out once and permanently cache the certificate.

---

bamboo@panda:/tmp$ svn co  https://<server_with_self_signed_cert>/path/to/repos
Error validating server certificate for 'https://<server_with_self_signed_cert>:443':
 - The certificate is not issued by a trusted authority. Use the

 - The certificate hostname does not match.
Certificate information:
 - Hostname: <server_with_self_signed_cert>
 - Valid: from Jan 23 22:40:32 2006 GMT until Jan 23 22:40:32 2026 GMT

 - Fingerprint: d2:4f:a0:f0:a3:13:f0:e0:3a:a6:22:97:96:47:00:4b:aa:c3:28:da
(R)eject, accept (t)emporarily or accept (p)ermanently?

fields.summary: Arguments field in bash script/script builders are mandatory

fields.description:
Bamboo should identify/categorize Junit tests with test suites, as well as classes and test name after the tests are run. 


N.B. This feature request was originally discussed in the forums (http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257245962).
fields.summary: additional level of identification for junit tests

fields.description:
Just deployed 1.0.4, which has quite a few Perforce-related fixes (many thanks for these!)

Spotted a problem when you follow the "full change details" link, ie to .../commit on a Perforce project, which is where you get "Expression file.revision is undefined on line 370, column 127 in lib/components.ftl".  I've attached the trace from the page to this issue.

Is there any chance that the change made for BAM-1096 has broken the functionality fixed in BAM-823?

Many thanks,

David
fields.summary: FishEye link from Perforce project causes exception

fields.description:
The Ant builder looks for the text "BUILD SUCCESSFUL" in the last 5 lines of the build logs. However, that may not always be correct as some logging (e.g. shutdown code) may push the ant "BUILD SUCCESSFUL" message beyond the designated 5 lines.

This requirement should be relaxed.
fields.summary: Ant builder checks last 5 lines for BUILD SUCCESSFUL

fields.description:
Path to a build artifact which contains a character which should be URL-escaped is not escaped which leads to a failure in retrieving said artifact.

E.g.  This path contains the hash or pound sign (#)  which should be escaped with %23
  http://tsunami:8085/download/GATHER-LC/artifacts/build-5/FooBar/3.2.2-#1

Should be
  http://tsunami:8085/download/GATHER-LC/artifacts/build-5/FooBar/3.2.2-%231
fields.summary: Artifact URL fails to escape invalid characters

fields.description:
Although Bamboo has detected changes in our Perforce repository, it doesn't appear to care.  It sync's the files to the local client workspace, but does not kick off the Ant build.  I've attached a screen shot of the activity view for our test project.

This may be related to BAM-747, though we are no experiencing any of the Hibernate issues that ticket describes.
fields.summary: Perforce modifications not causing build

fields.description:
It would be convenient to have the ability to add a build to a queue at the time you are initially creating the plan.

We removed the Default queue and have a series of specialized queues, none of which 'accept all builds'. When we create a new plan the initial build of it hangs until we go to the admin page and add it to a queue.
fields.summary: Ability to add plan to build queue as you are creating said plan

fields.description:
When having a single build queue and you remove that queue, you get a warning message stating you should always have a build queue in order to perform builds, but the queue is removed anyway.

Problem is, you can't add any new queues when the last one is gone. I had to alter the configurePipeline.ftl in the webapp/admin folder to always display the "new" queue fields in order to add a new queue.
fields.summary: Removing last build queue blocks use

fields.description:
Ability in Bamboo to broadcast a build comment via IM .

Bamboo should offer the option to broadcast that comment to everyone in the Bamboo IM List
fields.summary: Broadcast IM comments

fields.description: On the 'current activity' tab, the error messages listed at the bottom do not display the time or date for the errors. When you click on them there is no time or date, either. It would be nice to know when the errors occurred.
fields.summary: Error log shows no dates or times.

fields.description:
When I browse to Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20050915 Firefox/1.0.7 in Firefox, I get the page with two tabs and the message "Currently loading..."  However, the message never gets replaced with the various Plan statuses, nor when I clicked the other tab.  When I checked the javascript console, I saw the errors
Error: MO is not defined
and
Error: MU is not defined
so I'm guessing the AJAX callback is failing with some error?
fields.summary: "Currently loading" message never disappears in Firefox 1.0.7, due to javascript error.

fields.description: When editing an already existing build plan, you should be able to edit a build artifact entry instead of having to delete it and re-create it with slightly modified data.
fields.summary: You should be allowed to edit build artifacts

fields.summary: Request hangs trying to view a specific build, potential infinite loop?

fields.description:
In the dependencies tab of a plan, it would be nice to have a 'pre build dependency'. Right now, you can only specify builds that are to occur *after* the current build. It would be cool if we could specify a build that needs to happen *before* a build.

A simple case is where you have common libraries that many projects include. The common libraries can be their own build, but you might not want to trigger off 20 simultaneous builds of the other projects. As the other projects hit their schedule, they could look at the pre-build requisite and re-build it if necessary.
fields.summary: build "pre-dependency"

fields.description: On the home page, it would be cool if Cron based scheduled builds displayed when the next scheduled build will occur.
fields.summary: Cron schedule - Display next build

fields.description:
It would be nice to allow a single bamboo user to have multiple Source Repository Aliases.
In our SVN setup, sometimes the user will have different usernames in different repositories.
fields.summary: Multiple Source Repository Aliases for a user
No page associated with this URI

fields.description: When clicking on the stop icon for a build that isn't running yet in the Current Activity tab in one of the queues, the page reloads without any styles applied (and an 'ajaxy' URL).  The stop action also doesn't work.
fields.summary: Clicking on stop in the current activity queue doesn't work and shows page without styles

fields.description:
Currently bamboo uses the time stamp of the last build to detect changes.  If the bamboo server clock is out of sync with the perforce server clock, then bamboo can easily miss changes and not trigger builds if there are changes.

Therefore, bamboo needs to change the way it detects changes.
fields.summary: Change the way bamboo detects changes in perforce

fields.description:
The start_bamboo wrapper script uses "uname" in a way Debian does not recognize:

cruise@bamboo:~/bamboo$ ./wrapper/start-bamboo status
Try `uname --help' for more information.

The problem is "uname -p"
fields.summary: start-bamboo wrapper uses false uname syntax

fields.description: It would be a very useful to have a pre-build action. Expands the flexibility of the Bamboo build process significantly.
fields.summary: Allow pluggable pre-build actions

fields.description:
The user profile for any given user is visible even when not logged in.  The profile page lists: username, Full Name, email, Jabber Address, Groups, and Source Repository Alias.  Much of this information is semi-private and shouldn't be publically displayed.  Especially email addresses, as that opens up massive spam.  Please consider hiding email, Jabber Address & groups.

An example user profile page is at: https://www.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/user/sam
fields.summary: Hide User Info From Non-Admins

fields.description: With the 1.0.3 release a bug was introduced where if I expand a group of builds on the All Plans tab in Safari, it'll stay expanded for a couple of seconds and then collapse again.  This is not an issue on Firefox on my Mac.
fields.summary: All Plans view does not stay expanded on Safari

fields.description:
Minor issue, attached screenshot says it all.

Expected behavior: comment hover text should be above all other page elements
Actual behavior: comment hover text is obscured by page footer
fields.summary: z-index of comment hover text is lower than other page elements

fields.description:
I've got an issue (previously mentioned in comments to BAM-871) where new revisions in a SVN repository cause the build to sit in a loop during code refresh with the following message:

30-Mar-2007 08:04:03  	 Failed to get the build source code:ActiveRecord-JDBC - Trunk

30-Mar-2007 08:04:04 	Cleaning up subversion repository due to previous RepositoryException

The respository uses svn:// and svn+ssh:// URLs, which both exhibit this problem.

The build is located at: http://jruby.thresher.com/browse/ARJDBC-TRUNK

Server log attached.  Let me know if you want a login to the server so you can examine or tweak the build configuration.

fields.description: it is always usefull to be able to explains why the configuration parameters are what they are. Adding a comment field to the configuration form will help...
fields.summary: add a "comment" field to the build configuration form

fields.description:
A maven build can be launched with a username and a password system property defined on the command line.

In this case, it would be more secure to avoid displaying the password system property in the bamboo sites (maybe displaying -Dpassword=******** instead of the real thing).
fields.summary: hide -Dpassword maven options in the configuration and logs display

fields.description:
To remove excessive polling of the perforce repository we have cached the source code directory (known in Perforce as the client root).
However if the source code directory is changed (in the Perforce server configuration) Bamboo will require a restart to pick up the changes.
fields.summary: Perforce source code directory (client root) is currently cached

fields.description: Ability to to kick off the build only if changes in certain packages have been committed.
fields.summary: Triggering a build only on certain commits

fields.description:
I've set up a plan with a Perforce repository. It doesn't matter what I set the build schedule to be, if the build is enabled it is continuously polling the Perforce server for changes.

{code}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:41 | 2007-03-29 11:41:41,449 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [PerforceClientCommand] Executing perforce client command: 
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:41 | C:\Perforce\p4.exe -u xxxxx -p xxxxx:1666 -c xxxxxx client -o
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:41 | 2007-03-29 11:41:41,449 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [PerforceClientCommand] Executing perforce client command: 
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:41 | C:\Perforce\p4.exe -u xxxxx -p xxxxx:1666 -c xxxxx client -o
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:42 | 2007-03-29 11:41:42,561 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [PerforceClientCommand] Executing perforce client command: 
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:42 | C:\Perforce\p4.exe -u xxxxx -p xxxxx:1666 -c xxxxx client -o
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:42 | 2007-03-29 11:41:42,561 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [PerforceClientCommand] Executing perforce client command: 
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2007/03/29 11:41:42 | C:\Perforce\p4.exe -u xxxxx  -p xxxxx:1666 -c xxxxx client -o
{code}

Our Perforce administrators will not allow this, so because of this I have to keep the plan disabled and only enable it to run a build manually which totally defeats the purpose.
fields.summary: BuildChangeDetector continuously polling Perforce repository

fields.description:
The page/tab to define a Perforce repository could be improved.

The main field which seems to be either unnecessary, or at the least very confusingly named is "Depot".

The first question is why this field is necessary at all. Given that you have a client workspace specification why don't you just sync the whole thing? After all, if you want to change it, just update the client workspace??

If this field needs to stay, then at the very least it should be renamed and a much clearer comment inserted. In Perforce a depot is an entity created with "p4 depot" command - what is currently described is veyr confusing for any experienced Perforce user.

Given that what is required here is the client view path from the client workspace, can I suggest:

Name:  Client workspace view path
Description: The right hand side of the desired client workspace view, e.g. //fred_ws/main/...
fields.summary: Change terminology/function of Perforce Source Repository page

fields.description:
I have some projects that create no tests; testing is done in separate (dependent) projects.

There's no point saying "No tests found!" with exclamation marks in the home page for such a project, as not having tests is clearly something it was configured not to have.
fields.summary: Stop the GUI from overreacting when a no-tests project has no tests

fields.description:
The network went down during the initial checkout from the SCM repository; not everything got checked out.

-the tool seemed to think it was still in the 'preparing for the initial build' state,; stopping the build didnt affect this. A server stop/start seemed to do the trick.

Since then, the build is in a bad state. Bamboo tries to run, but of course there is no build.xml

-failures to check out need to be handled...there's no point trying to run ant until all the files are there
fields.summary: Bad recovery from failure for initial checkout to complete

fields.description:
I am setting up a bamboo system behind a firewall. There is no easy way to set up proxy settings for bamboo itself, other than by editing bamboo.sh, which I have done -SVN and JIRA then go through the wall to the public repostories.

But the proxy settings are not passed down to ant, which we need for Ivy.

1. They are defined in the ANT_OPTS env variable, but this is not passed down, and there is no way to set an env variable with spaces in it in the dialog (try it)

2. you can do -D definitions for Ant, but these are Ant properties, not system properties.

The only way to set up the proxy that worked was to edit ant.sh and patch in the proxy settings there.
fields.summary: No way to pass proxy information down to Ant

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to disable a build from the dashboard rather than have to go into the build itself
Probably just add another icon/button neext to play/configure etc.
fields.summary: Disable plan accessible from on the dashboard

fields.description:
Our Bamboo instance keeps performing a build and won't stop.  We have a 10 minute sleep period and our build only takes 2 minutes, so that should be plenty of time.  I believe the problem is that a developer accidentally checked a [target] directory into CVS.  Bamboo said, I detect changes between the module I have checked out and the module in the repository, so let me do a build.  When the build runs, classes are compiled to the target directory and unit tests get outputted there as well.  This causes Bamboo to say 10 minutes later, there are differences between my local checkout and the CVS repository, so let me do a build.  Thus, begins the vicious cycle

Yes, a developer should not have checked in a target directory into CVS.  However, I'd argue that Bamboo should not get stuck in this building loop, just because a developer made a mistake.
fields.summary: Bamboo keeps building and won't stop

fields.description:
We produce ears, jars and msis out of our build.  Those mime-types are currently not supported.  We'd like to see something like:

    <mime-mapping>
        <extension>msi</extension>
        <mime-type>application/x-msi</mime-type>
    </mime-mapping>    
    <mime-mapping>
        <extension>ear</extension>
        <mime-type>application/zip</mime-type>
    </mime-mapping>    
    <mime-mapping>
        <extension>war</extension>
        <mime-type>application/zip</mime-type>
    </mime-mapping>
fields.summary: New mime types for bamboo artifact downloads

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a repository type that would allow for a URL to an Eclipse Team Set to be specified for the repository type.

We currently use the Eclipse Team Set to specify the components that need to be pulled in for a project build.

In order to use Bamboo we patched it to add a new repository type called 'Eclipse SVN Team Set'.  A truly robust version of the repository should allow for any supported source control repository to be specified.  At our company we use SVN so the version of the resository we created support only Subversion.   Work like a champ though!

See attached for patch for 1.0.2 version of Bamboo.
fields.summary: Eclipse Team Set Repository Type

fields.description:
Frequently, a user will commit code to CVS and Bamboo will run, but not know who did the check-in.  Specifically, the reason given is Update By Unknown. An example of the details include the following:

This build was the result of the following change:

    * Unknown
      Unknown

      Could not get a change log for this change.
          o /ant/module-build.xml (version Unknown)
fields.summary: Bamboo sometimes doesn't know who did CVS commit

fields.description: Bamboo reports that it executed twice as many unit tests than actually exist in the project.  Eclipse and Hudson both report 459 unit tests, while Bamboo reports 918 tests executed.
fields.summary: Bamboo reports twice as many unit test

fields.description:
Bamboo frequently reports the error "Failed to get the build source code" after being triggered by a SVN  commit. The apparent cause from the stack trace is that the connection to Subversion has been reset. This causes Bamboo to execute a clean operation followed by an update which then succeeds. Several other build systems tested in this same environment against the same repository do not exhibit similar issues.

fields.description:
Bamboo appears to be hanging quiet often (every couple of hours) for the Spring project builds at http://build.springframework.org:8085.  The build is manifest as the CPU pegging to 100% and the servlet container not returning pages to users (leaving the connection open).  Typically a restart helps this problem.  When the logs are checked we the following error:

007-03-21 03:28:46,958 WARN [Timer-0] [ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner] com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$DeadlockDetector@1999a3d
-- APPARENT DEADLOCK!!! Creating emergency threads for unassigned pending tasks!
2007-03-21 03:29:20,513 ERROR [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [DefaultBuildChangeDetector] Failed to get the build source code
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Spring LDAP - trunk
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.SvnRepository.getChangesSinceLastBuild(SvnRepository.java:376)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.strategy.PollingBuildStrategy.requiresBuild(PollingBuildStrategy.java:126)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.DefaultBuildChangeDetector.checkIfBuildNeedsBuilding(DefaultBuildChangeDetector.java:166)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.DefaultBuildChangeDetector.doTask(DefaultBuildChangeDetector.java:114)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.DefaultBuildChangeDetector.run(DefaultBuildChangeDetector.java:77)
        at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.helpers.ThreadHelpers$1.run(ThreadHelpers.java:34)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: PROPFIND request
failed on '/svnroot/springframework/spring-ldap/trunk'
svn: Remote host closed connection during handshake
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:48)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVUtil.findStartingProperties(DAVUtil.java:124)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVUtil.getBaselineProperties(DAVUtil.java:197)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVUtil.getBaselineInfo(DAVUtil.java:160)
        at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVRepository.getLatestRevision(DAVRepository.java:147)
        at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.SvnRepository.getChangesSinceLastBuild(SvnRepository.java:327)

From this stack it appears that the connection to the SVN repo at SourceForge is timing out.  We see this as users a bit, so while unfortunate, it's not uncommon.

It's important to note that this isn't limited to just the LDAP project, all of our projects get this issue at various times.  In fact, we see it on the SF SVN projects, an analogous error on SF CVS projects, and an error on java.net CVS projects.

As I said earlier, we're running into this problem every couple of hours.  We really like the Bamboo product and are using it heavily, but this issue prevents us from publicizing our use of it and recommending it to others.

fields.description:
I cannot edit the configuration of my builds
When I click on the EDIT button, the page is displayed without any content.

That is to say, I have the header whith the tabs , and the footer but no form to edit the data
But while creating a plan, I have the full page.

of course i'm admin...

fields.description: While externals' changes are being picked up, the fisheye link for the changed files are not correct (it assumes the files are under the root module). Further investigation required to find a way to capture this correctly.
fields.summary: Changes in SVN Externals do not generate correct Fisheye links

fields.description:
ANT_HOME environment variable appears to take precedence over which version of Ant is configured as the builder.

ANT_HOME pointed to a 1.6.2 version. I was getting a Class org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.ConditionTask doesn't support the "else" attribute error, even though the builder was version 1.6.5. Once I reset the variable and restarted tomcat, everything worked properly.
fields.summary: ANT_HOME is used for ant

fields.description: When download artifacts, Bamboo fails to set the ContentLength header to the size of the file. The lack of the file size prevents the browser from displaying download progress properly since it cannot determine the bytes reamining.
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to set ContentLength when downloading build artifacts

fields.description:
When I restarted my browser, went to the start page, clicked on a detail screen and then tried to log in, I got a Null Pointer exception (see attached screenshot).

Unfortuneately there is nothing in the log.
fields.summary: Null pointer when relogging in after session has died

fields.description:
When specifying a cron trigger, I used 

0 0 20 * * MON-THU

It appeared to save ok, but when it didn't run the build I checked the bamboo.log file and found

2007-03-20 09:56:22,576 ERROR [SocketListener0-7] [CronTriggerBuildStrategy] java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Support for specifying both a day-of-week AND a day-of-month parameter is not implemented.

fields.description:
It doesn't make sense for the builds to kick off after creating a plan/editing a plan for manual or even dependent builds as they are most likely to fail. It would be good to allow customers an option for "build immediately after save".

From forums: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257244639#257244639
fields.summary: Option to kick off build after saving a plan create/update

fields.description: I really like the Top 10 Longest Running Tests report and it's nice to be able to drill down into a test to see how long it took, but it would be even more helpful if the report included the method source that was the test (and possibly any other methods that the method relied on as an optional expansion?). In that way, it would be easier to see what may be causing the test to take so long.
fields.summary: Top 10 Longest Running Tests report of test could show the actual implementation of the test

fields.description:
When moving betweeb tabs on the configuration page it keeps erroring 

Line: 527
Char: 9
Error: Invalid argument
Code: 0
URL http://localhost:8085/build/admin/edit/editBuildConfiguration.action?buildKey=CLO-DEF

This especially occurs after viewing the artifacts tab.

Most of the time it just wont load the new tab and will remain on the orginal.  Occasionally however the tabs will change but no content will be shown.
fields.summary: Artifacts Tab on build configuration tab is mis-behaving

fields.description:
I was just going through the Bamboo startup script and I noticed that the JVM was not getting started up in server mode.

I know the '-server' option is added to JIRA and Confluence.
fields.summary: Modify bamboo.sh to start the JVM in 'server' mode

fields.description:
Today its only possible to configurate the Build expiry by saying the number of days to keep. In some cases I would like to set it to keep the last x builds. Or an alternativ to this is to possibility to mark some builds to not be expirable.
An example of this is for projects that are finished and no one is working for a while with the project. It would be nice to still have the last builds. And in some cases to have some builds from milestones in the projects stored.

This is not a big issue, but a nice to have feature imo.
fields.summary: Build Expiry Settings - mark some build as non expirable

fields.description:
This should be available as an option

After the code changes has been detected we can remove the source directory, and then do a full checkout
fields.summary: Allow a full checkout to be performed for each change

fields.description:
The build is failing because it is trying to copy artifacts that don't exist.

However, the copy task that is attempted by the builder is a old configuration and has already been removed from the configuration.

The steps to reproduce are:

1. Create a build artifact copy task that is known to fail.
2. Kick off a build
3. Delete the task from the configuration
4. Kick off another build

Somehow the task remains persisted although it has been removed from the GUI.
fields.summary: Build artifacts copy is attempted although the action has been removed from the configuration

fields.description:
Clicking on latest build from home screen does not render the Artifacts or JIRA tabs ( i.e. via this link http://foohost:8085/browse/FOOPROJECT-DEF/latest )

To get these to be rendered, you have to click on the build number on that page (i.e. http://foohost:8085/browse/FOOPROJECT-DEF/FOOPROJECT-DEF-BUILDNUMBER).

It would be nice to do this in one click.

I'll attach a screenshot.
fields.summary: Clicking on latest build from home screen does not render the Artifacts or JIRA tabs

fields.description:
Our build and unit test process ends up generating a huge gob of logging info.  When I try to view a failed builds log file in bamboo, Firefox on the Mac at least tends to hang while it tries to render this.

I would really like to have a link that I could click on that allows me to download the builds log file to a local plain text (no HTML thanks) log file file for further analysis.

Even better, if there was some way to mark in the build log info for a given failing unit test what the System.out and System.err looked like while that build was running.

I would count this as pretty important (for me! :) ) as I'm finding it very hard to see what exactly is going on with some of our unit tests when running in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Ability to download particular build log file

fields.summary: Internal server error when trying to view Latest Build

fields.description: When you view a plan by using the 'latest' plan in the URL, (ie: http://www.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/LW-NIGHTLY/latest ) , the links for 'Summary', 'Tests', 'Changes', 'Log', and 'Comments' are incorrect.  They look something like: "www.limewire.org/bambooExpression buildNumber is undefined in line 1, column 23 in URLTemplate. [...]"  These URLs are linked from the main project summary page, so someone clicking through the latest plan from the main page sees the errors quickly.  Clicking the plan number on that page fixes the links (and also causes the 'Artifacts' tab to appear, if the build had artifacts).
fields.summary: Links Are Incorrect When Using 'latest' as the build in the URL

fields.description:
Click on any build result link brings up build results screen at the summary tab (bamboo-build-results-summary.png).  Click on any other tab (bamboo-build-results-othertabs.png) yields blank screen.

Stack trace from server.log is attached (bamboo-stacktrace.txt).

fields.summary: Internal error when deleting plans with dependencies

fields.description:
When not logged in and viewing a comments page like this one
http://.../bamboo/build/viewComments.action?buildKey=CONFFUNC-MAIN&buildNumber=1196

The Login link is
http://.../bamboo/userlogin!default.action?os_destination=/build/viewComments.action?buildKey=CONFFUNC-MAIN&buildNumber=1196

That destination leads to unhappy Internal Error page becuase the &buildNumber=1196 is interpreted as a separate parameter, not as part of os_destination.
I guess the & needs to be escaped.
fields.summary: Login link on comment page broken

fields.description:
when the server encounters an error (something that would end up in the error area on the main page) it would be nice to use the existing notification mechanisms (email, jabber, etc) to notify server administrators

had a problem with one project where a merge>rollback>merge on the source repository ended up with some residual files that caused the subversion update to fail

the build in question got disabled but didn't report a failure
fields.summary: notification to administrators when the server encounters an error

fields.description:
For some reason, Bamboo does not recognize all the test case results from build to build.  We have a total of 176 tests cases, and sometimes it recognizes all 176, and sometimes it recognizes only a subset.  I cannot determine a pattern or relationship to the ones that are included in the subset, or excluded from the total results.  We use TestNG, and the output result xml file should be junit compliant.  

Is anyone else experiencing this?  I can collect some more details if you need any.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Test Results between builds

fields.description:
All plans are unable to retrieve changelogs for the files that changed.

The bamboo.log shows:
---
2007-03-13 00:05:50,943 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [CVSRepository] Found 6 changes from update
2007-03-13 00:05:50,986 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [CVSRepository] Running CVS log command: "log -N -r -d>2007-03-12 17:55:32 build-macros.xml AtomicLazyReference.java DefaultThreadFactory.java DefaultMessageID.java AbstractSecurityToken.java FakeProxyServer.java "
2007-03-13 00:05:50,987 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [CVSRepository]                  ... in:  "/spare/bamboo/data/xml-data/build-dir/LW-COMPILE/limewire"
2007-03-13 00:05:53,154 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [CVSRepository] Found 0 changes sets in the change logs
2007-03-13 00:05:53,154 INFO [BAM::BuildChangeDetector] [CVSRepository] something wrong with the change logs, so lets work out what's changed...
---

A little bit of detective work (by running the command and similar commands on the commandline) shows the following problems:

1) None of the files include their directories, which leads to the server knowing nothing about the files.
2) The date & time are not quoted, which leads to the server printing out a change on the given date, not at the given time.  It also causes the server to look for a change in a file whose name is the time.
3) The '>' is not escaped, which on the commandline caused the result to be piped to a file whose name was the date.  (I don't know if this effects the process the CVS command is run in.)
4) The '-r' parameter is used, which leads to only a single revision being shown.  This effectively hides any earlier commit messages on files that were updated twice between builds.

This is a huge problem.  Any help would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Never Can Retrieve Changelogs

fields.description: Please consider adding file include/exclude patterns for change-based build triggers.  We have scripts that run every night to automatically update foreign locale messagebundles, among other unnecessary files, and would like to prevent those changes from triggering builds in plans that use those modules.
fields.summary: Allow include/exclude patterns for triggering build

fields.description:
Please allow multiple CVS modules to be listed as the module for a CVS-based plan.  The use-case for this is CVS repository with code broken into multiple modules, where one particular component wants to be tested but other modules (such as 'lib') are required.

Our CVS repository, for example, has top-level modules named: core, gui, lib, tests, and components.  We also have an amper-module called 'limewire' that has some additional top-level data and then references those.  For Bamboo, we have three plans: LW-COMPILATION, LW-NIGHTLY, and LW-COMPONENTS.  The compilation plan just checks that all the code compiles and runs whenever anything in the 'limewire' module changes.  We can't run all the tests all the time because they take too long to run.  The nightly plan runs every night and runs the full test suite.  The components build is where the problem lies.

The components module requires the lib module is checked out as a sibling, and references those files.  To workaround this, I created an amper-module that gets both components & lib.  It would be nice if this workaround were not required, and Bamboo would allow multiple modules per plan.
fields.summary: Allow One Plan To Be Based On Multiple CVS Modules

fields.description:
The email that Bamboo generates has line-breaks after 80 (around 80, at least) characters when listing the names of changed files.  Please consider removing that line break (and the leading >'s), as they only serve to make reading the changes harder.

This is an example email it sends:

---
The project LimeWire - Components has the following 1 change by 1 author:

*Unknown* made the following changes at 10:29 PM, 12 March 2007

Comment:
Could not get a change log for this change.

> /components/mojito/src/main/java/org/limewire/mojito/messages/impl/Def
> aultMessageID.java (Unknown)

        

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The build has 18 failed tests and 884 successful tests.

Click http://www.limewire.org/bamboo/browse/LW-COMPONENTS-11 to find out more.

Thanks,

Bamboo
---
fields.summary: Email Shouldn't Break Lines

fields.description: The emails bamboo generates should optionally contain more information (up to maybe a certain size) so that someone can see the full results in the email instead of having to click through to the UI (and so that data can be seen in the email client if the pipes are down).
fields.summary: Generate Emails with More Info

fields.description:

12-Mar-2007 16:59:32      [mkdir] Created dir: /spare/​bamboo/​data/​xml-data/​build-dir/​LW-COMPONENTS/​comp-test/​components/​nio/​build/​tests  
12-Mar-2007 16:59:32      [javac] Compiling 31 source files to /spare/​bamboo/​data/​xml-data/​build-dir/​LW-COMPONENTS/​comp-test/​components/​nio/​build/​tests  
12-Mar-2007 16:59:33  
---
fields.summary: Output Shows Directories With Undisplayable Character

fields.description: I am attempting to setup a wrapper start script that sets all necessary environment variables and then starts bamboo, so that we don't have to redo scripts every time we update bamboo.  This includes attempting to set the 'bamboo.home' variable, which should work according to the bamboo-init.properties file (I do not want to have to re-edit that file after every upgrade).  However, "bamboo.home" is not a valid environment variable name because it contains a period in it.  Please consider replacing this variable with something that does not include a period, or allowing an additional parameter so Linux run scripts can set it.
fields.summary: bamboo.home is not a valid environment variable

fields.description:
The current Error Summary for build is whatever is piped to the the standard error log. While this works quite well with Ant, where things like compilation errors are logged to the error stream, most Maven 2 errors are logged to standard out, rendering it pretty useless.

For Maven 2 builds, we should ignore the standard error and parse std out for the errors instead. 


An example of this problem is at http://opensource.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/STRUTS-MAIN-204

The error summary doesn't really give any useful info. It's only when you check out the "Logs" tab and scroll to the bottom, you can see that it's actually a compilation error. *This* is what we'd want in the Error Summary
